wikipedia_page.main: Aidan Southall (11 September 1920 – 17 May 2009) was a British cultural anthropologist recognised for his fieldwork in urban settings in post-war Africa. Often identified as a pioneer in the study of African cities, Southall is said to have played a significant role in the development of urban anthropology. He was married to Christine Obbo, they have a son and a daughter. In 2009, Aidan Southall died.
